page.title: 08Nuneaton Common
page.content: The Common situated off{Bucks Hill}is reached by a footpath which runs alongside a large cemetery. A disused railway embankment provides a useful way of crossing the Common though it is somewhat overgrown with small{oak {trees}and{elder.}There are signs of horseriding and dog exercising along this path. Some large grassed areas provide suitable sites for picnics. There is no development for sporting use or other leisure activities. Areas which are little used are reverting back to natural form with a multiplicity of wild flowers. Bordering the Common near{Plough Hill is a concrete works with an enormous tip at its edge. Housing surrounding the Common often carried dates, most being built in the late 19th century with occasional infilling of small private estates.
